searchDocs.title: 🎉 Overview​
searchDocs.content: We're excited to announce the beta release of QA Advisor (formerly QA Analytics) at WordCamp Europe 2025! This beta version represents a major evolution in WordPress analytics, introducing powerful new features for understanding user behavior through visual analytics.

searchDocs.title: 🔥 Heatmap Analytics​
searchDocs.content: Click Heatmaps: Visualize where users click most frequently on your pagesScroll Depth Tracking: Understand how far users scroll down your contentMovement Heatmaps: Track mouse movement patterns to identify user attention areasMobile & Desktop Views: Separate heatmap data for different device types

searchDocs.title: 📊 Enhanced Analytics Dashboard​
searchDocs.content: Real-time Data Visualization: See user interactions as they happenAdvanced Filtering: Filter data by date range, device type, and user segmentsExport Capabilities: Download heatmap data and reports for further analysis

searchDocs.title: 🚀 Performance Improvements​
searchDocs.content: Optimized Data Collection: Minimal impact on site performanceEfficient Storage: Smart data compression for heatmap informationFaster Loading Times: 30% improvement in analytics dashboard loading

searchDocs.title: 🔧 Developer Features​
searchDocs.content: New API Endpoints: Access heatmap data programmaticallyCustom Event Tracking: Define your own interaction eventsIntegration Hooks: Easy integration with other WordPress plugins

searchDocs.title: 📋 System Requirements​
searchDocs.content: WordPress 5.0 or higherPHP 7.4 or higherMySQL 5.7 or higherModern browsers (Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+, Edge 90+)

searchDocs.title: Setup Wizard​
searchDocs.content: When you first activate QA Advisor, you'll see a setup wizard. This section covers each step:

searchDocs.title: Step 1: Welcome & License​
searchDocs.content: Welcome Screen Read the brief introductionAccept terms of serviceEnter license key (for premium features) License Activation (Beta users can skip) Enter your license keyClick "Activate License"Verify activation status

searchDocs.title: Step 2: Basic Configuration​
searchDocs.content: Configure fundamental settings:  Tracking Settings​  □ Enable Click Tracking □ Enable Scroll Tracking □ Enable Mouse Movement Tracking □ Enable Form Analytics □ Enable Session Recording (Premium)   Recommended: Enable all for comprehensive analytics  User Privacy​  □ Anonymize IP Addresses □ Respect Do Not Track □ Enable Cookie Consent □ GDPR Compliance Mode   Important: Enable based on your jurisdiction's requirements

searchDocs.title: Step 3: Advanced Settings​
searchDocs.content: Data Collection​  Sampling Rate  100% - Track all visitors (recommended for small sites)50% - Track half of visitors (balanced approach)25% - Track quarter of visitors (high-traffic sites)  Data Retention  30 days - Minimum recommended90 days - Default (recommended)365 days - Maximum retention  Performance Options​  Script Loading  Async - Non-blocking (recommended)Defer - Load after pageNormal - Standard loading  Cache Duration  1 hour - Real-time priority6 hours - Balanced (default)24 hours - Performance priority

searchDocs.title: Manual Configuration​
searchDocs.content: If you skip the wizard, configure settings manually:

searchDocs.title: 1. General Settings​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to Settings → QA Advisor → General  Site Name: Your website identifierTime Zone: Match your WordPress timezoneLanguage: Interface languageEmail Reports: Weekly/monthly summaries

searchDocs.title: 2. Tracking Configuration​
searchDocs.content: Go to Settings → QA Advisor → Tracking  Pages to Track​  Include Rules: - All Pages (default) - Specific URLs: /products/*, /blog/* - Post Types: post, page, product Exclude Rules: - Admin pages: /wp-admin/* - Checkout: /checkout/* - Account pages: /my-account/*   User Roles​  Configure which user roles to track:  □ Administrator - Usually excluded □ Editor - Optional □ Author - Optional □ Contributor - Recommended □ Subscriber - Recommended □ Guest/Visitor - Always tracked

searchDocs.title: 3. Heatmap Settings​
searchDocs.content: Heatmap Resolution  High - Detailed tracking (more data)Medium - Balanced (recommended)Low - Basic tracking (less data)  Click Aggregation  1px - Precise (high CPU usage)5px - Default (recommended)10px - Grouped (better performance)

searchDocs.title: 4. Integration Settings​
searchDocs.content: Google Analytics​  □ Enable GA Integration GA Tracking ID: UA-XXXXX-Y □ Import historical data □ Sync events   Other Integrations​  WooCommerce: Track product interactionsContact Form 7: Form submission analyticsElementor: Page builder compatibility

searchDocs.title: Verification Checklist​
searchDocs.content: After setup, verify everything is working:

searchDocs.title: ✓ Tracking Script​
searchDocs.content: View your site's source code and look for:  <!-- QA Advisor Analytics --> <script async src="/wp-content/plugins/qa-advisor/assets/tracking.js"></script>

searchDocs.title: ✓ Data Collection​
searchDocs.content: Open your site in an incognito windowClick around and scrollReturn to QA Advisor dashboardCheck for new data (may take 5 minutes)

searchDocs.title: ✓ Heatmap Generation​
searchDocs.content: Visit a page on your sitePerform several clicksGo to QA Advisor → HeatmapsSelect the pageVerify heatmap appears

searchDocs.title: ✓ Performance Impact​
searchDocs.content: Test site speed:  Use Google PageSpeed InsightsCompare before/after scoresAdjust settings if needed

searchDocs.title: No Data Appearing​
searchDocs.content: Check JavaScript console for errorsVerify tracking code is presentEnsure you're not blocking your own IPClear all caches

searchDocs.title: Heatmaps Not Generating​
searchDocs.content: Minimum 10 interactions requiredWait for aggregation (hourly)Check heatmap settingsVerify page is being tracked

searchDocs.title: High Server Load​
searchDocs.content: Reduce sampling rateIncrease cache durationEnable data aggregationConsider CDN for assets

searchDocs.title: Security Recommendations​
searchDocs.content: Regular Updates Enable auto-updates for security patchesCheck for updates weekly Access Control Limit dashboard access to adminsUse strong passwordsEnable 2FA if available Data Protection Regular backupsSSL certificate requiredEncrypted data storage

searchDocs.title: Method 1: WordPress Admin Dashboard (Recommended)​
searchDocs.content: Download the Plugin Download qa-heatmap-analytics.zip from the official website Upload via WordPress Admin Log in to your WordPress admin dashboardNavigate to Plugins → Add NewClick Upload Plugin button at the topChoose the downloaded zip fileClick Install Now Activate the Plugin After installation, click Activate PluginYou'll be redirected to the QA Advisor welcome page

searchDocs.title: Method 2: FTP Upload​
searchDocs.content: Extract the Plugin Unzip qa-heatmap-analytics.zip on your computer Upload via FTP Connect to your server using FTP clientNavigate to /wp-content/plugins/ directoryUpload the extracted qa-advisor folder Activate in WordPress Log in to WordPress adminGo to Plugins pageFind QA Advisor and click Activate

searchDocs.title: Method 3: WP-CLI (Advanced)​
searchDocs.content: If you have WP-CLI installed:  # Install from local file wp plugin install qa-heatmap-analytics.zip --activate # Or if hosted on WordPress.org (future) wp plugin install qa-advisor --activate

searchDocs.title: Q: Is QA Advisor compatible with my WordPress version?​
searchDocs.content: A: QA Advisor requires WordPress 5.0 or higher. We recommend always using the latest stable version of WordPress for security and compatibility.

searchDocs.title: Q: Can I install QA Advisor on multiple sites?​
searchDocs.content: A:  Beta Version: Can be used on unlimited sitesFree Version (coming soon): Limited to 1 sitePro Version (coming soon): Multiple site licenses available

searchDocs.title: Q: Will QA Advisor slow down my website?​
searchDocs.content: A: QA Advisor is optimized for performance:  Asynchronous script loadingMinimal impact (typically less than 100ms)Smart caching systemCDN support for assets  Most users see no noticeable performance impact.

searchDocs.title: Q: Is QA Advisor compatible with page builders?​
searchDocs.content: A: Yes! QA Advisor works with:  ElementorGutenberg (Block Editor)DiviBeaver BuilderWPBakeryAnd most other page builders

searchDocs.title: Q: What data does QA Advisor collect?​
searchDocs.content: A: QA Advisor collects:  Click locations and frequencyScroll depthMouse movement patternsPage views and session durationDevice and browser informationGeographic location (country/city level)  Not collected:  Personal informationEmail addressesForm input data (unless specifically enabled)Payment information

searchDocs.title: Q: How do I exclude my own visits from tracking?​
searchDocs.content: A: Several methods:  User Role Exclusion (Recommended) Go to Settings → QA Advisor → TrackingUncheck "Administrator" role IP Exclusion Settings → QA Advisor → FiltersAdd your IP address Cookie Method Use the "Exclude My Visits" button in dashboard

searchDocs.title: Q: What's the difference between heatmaps and recordings?​
searchDocs.content: A:  Heatmaps: Aggregated data from all users showing patternsSession Recordings: Individual user sessions (Premium feature)  Heatmaps are included in all versions, while recordings are a premium feature.

searchDocs.title: Q: Is QA Advisor GDPR compliant?​
searchDocs.content: A: Yes! QA Advisor includes:  IP anonymization optionsCookie consent integrationData deletion toolsExport capabilitiesPrivacy-by-design architecture  Enable "GDPR Compliance Mode" in settings for full compliance.

searchDocs.title: Q: Where is my data stored?​
searchDocs.content: A:  Beta/Self-hosted: Your WordPress databaseCloud Version (coming): Secure cloud servers with encryptionAll data is encrypted and backed up regularly

searchDocs.title: Q: Can visitors opt-out of tracking?​
searchDocs.content: A: Yes, multiple ways:  Respect "Do Not Track" browser settingCookie consent banner integrationDirect opt-out linkJavaScript API for custom implementation

searchDocs.title: Q: What browsers are supported?​
searchDocs.content: A: Full support for:  Chrome/Edge (last 2 versions)Firefox (last 2 versions)Safari (last 2 versions)  Limited support:  Internet Explorer 11 (basic tracking only)Older mobile browsers

searchDocs.title: Q: Does QA Advisor work with caching plugins?​
searchDocs.content: A: Yes! Compatible with:  WP RocketW3 Total CacheWP Super CacheLiteSpeed CacheCloudflare  No special configuration needed in most cases.

searchDocs.title: Q: Can I track AJAX content?​
searchDocs.content: A: Yes! QA Advisor automatically tracks:  Dynamic content updatesSingle Page Applications (SPA)AJAX form submissionsInfinite scroll content

searchDocs.title: Q: Why don't I see any data?​
searchDocs.content: A: Check these common issues:  Just Installed: Wait 5-10 minutes for initial dataCaching: Clear all caches (browser, plugin, CDN)Ad Blockers: May block tracking scriptsJavaScript Errors: Check browser consoleExcluded Role: Ensure you're not excluding yourself

searchDocs.title: Q: Heatmaps are not showing​
searchDocs.content: A: Heatmaps require:  Minimum 10 page interactionsAt least 1 hour of data collectionJavaScript enabled in visitor browsersCorrect page selection in dashboard

searchDocs.title: Q: Getting "License Invalid" error​
searchDocs.content: A: For beta users:  License not required during betaClick "Skip" or "Continue without license"Contact support if error persists

searchDocs.title: Q: What's included in the Beta version?​
searchDocs.content: A: Beta includes:  All heatmap types (click, move, scroll)Basic analytics dashboardPage-level insightsExport capabilitiesEmail support  Not included (coming in Pro):  Session recordingsAdvanced segmentsA/B testingAPI accessPriority support

searchDocs.title: Q: Can I export my data?​
searchDocs.content: A: Yes! Export options:  CSV format for raw dataPNG/PDF for heatmap imagesJSON for API integrationFull database export

searchDocs.title: Q: How long is data retained?​
searchDocs.content: A: Default retention:  Beta: 90 daysFree (coming): 30 daysPro (coming): 365 daysEnterprise: Unlimited  You can adjust retention in Settings.

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: The Audience screen provides comprehensive insights into your website visitors' demographics, behavior patterns, and characteristics. This section helps you understand who your visitors are, how they interact with your site, and what devices and technologies they use to access your content.

searchDocs.title: Accessing This Screen​
searchDocs.content: Log in to your WordPress admin panelNavigate to the left sidebar menuClick on "QA Advisor"Select "Audience" from the submenu

searchDocs.title: Screen Layout​

searchDocs.title: Overview​

This feature uses machine learning algorithms to identify patterns, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization that might not be immediately obvious from raw analytics data.

searchDocs.title: Accessing This Screen​
searchDocs.content: Log in to your WordPress admin panelNavigate to the left sidebar menuClick on "QA Advisor"Select "Brains" from the submenu

searchDocs.title: Screen Layout​

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: The Top Growing screen identifies pages and content on your website that are experiencing the fastest growth in traffic, engagement, or conversions. This feature helps you spot trending content, capitalize on viral opportunities, and understand what resonates most with your audience.

searchDocs.title: Accessing This Screen​
searchDocs.content: Log in to your WordPress admin panelNavigate to the left sidebar menuClick on "QA Advisor"Select "Top Growing" from the submenu

searchDocs.content: The Top Growing screen displays:  Growth Rate Rankings: Pages ranked by percentage increase in key metricsTrending Content List: Content showing significant upward trendsGrowth Metrics Comparison: Before and after statistics for growing pagesTime Period Selector: Choose the timeframe for growth analysisGrowth Categories: Different types of growth (traffic, engagement, conversions)Trend Visualization: Charts showing growth patterns over time

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: The Settings screen is the central configuration hub for the QA Advisor plugin, allowing you to customize tracking behavior, privacy settings, data collection preferences, and integration options. This section provides comprehensive control over how the plugin operates on your website and what data it collects.

searchDocs.title: Accessing This Screen​
searchDocs.content: Log in to your WordPress admin panelNavigate to the left sidebar menuClick on "QA Advisor"Select "Settings" from the submenu

searchDocs.title: Screen Layout​
searchDocs.content: The Settings screen is organized into several configuration sections:  General Settings: Basic plugin configuration and site informationTracking Settings: Data collection and analytics preferencesPrivacy Settings: GDPR compliance and user privacy controlsIntegration Settings: Third-party service connections and API configurationsAdvanced Settings: Technical configuration options for experienced usersData Management: Import, export, and data retention settings

searchDocs.title: General Configuration​
searchDocs.content: Purpose: Configure basic plugin settings and site identificationHow to use: Set your site name, timezone, and basic tracking preferencesOptions: Site identification, default date ranges, and display preferencesTips: Ensure timezone settings match your business location for accurate reporting

searchDocs.title: Tracking Configuration​
searchDocs.content: Purpose: Control what data is collected and how it's processedHow to use: Enable or disable specific tracking features based on your needsOptions: Page views, user interactions, conversion tracking, and custom eventsTips: Balance comprehensive tracking with site performance and privacy requirements

searchDocs.title: Privacy and Compliance​
searchDocs.content: Purpose: Ensure compliance with privacy regulations like GDPR and CCPAHow to use: Configure consent management, data anonymization, and user rightsOptions: Cookie consent, IP anonymization, data retention periods, and user opt-outTips: Regularly review privacy settings to maintain compliance with evolving regulations

searchDocs.title: Third-party Integrations​
searchDocs.content: Purpose: Connect QA Advisor with other tools and servicesHow to use: Configure API connections, data sharing, and external service integrationsOptions: Google Analytics, social media platforms, email marketing tools, and CRM systemsTips: Only enable integrations you actively use to minimize data sharing and complexity
